citation.article-title: Iamia majanohamensis gen. nov., sp. nov., an actinobacterium isolated from sea cucumber Holothuria edulis, and proposal of Iamiaceae fam. nov.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Iamia majanohamensis sp. nov.
Iamia majanohamensis (ma.ja.no.ha.men′sis. N.L. fem. adj. majanohamensis pertaining to Majanohama, the site on the coast of Aka Island, Japan, where the type strain was isolated).
In addition to the properties given in the genus description, cells are 1.2–1.7×0.3–0.5 μm in size.
Colonies on MA are small, white, circular, convex, smooth, shiny and 0.2–0.3 mm in diameter after 3 weeks incubation at 30 °C.
No growth occurs at temperatures above 45 °C or below 10 °C.
Cell-wall sugars are rhamnose, mannose, arabinose, galactose and xylose.

Positive for catalase, oxidase, arginine dihydrolase, lysine decarboxylase, ornithine decarboxylase, production of acetoin and gelatinase and reduction of nitrate to N2, but negative for β-galactosidase, urease, tryptophan deaminase, utilization of citrate, production of H2S and indole and assimilation of amygdalin, arabinose, d-glucose, inositol, d-mannose, melibiose, rhamnose, sucrose and sorbitol.
The DNA G+C content is 74.4 mol%.
The type strain, F12T (=NBRC 102561T=DSM 19957T), was isolated from the ventral epidermis of the sea cucumber Holothuria edulis at Aka Island, Okinawa, Japan.
